description: The Republic of South Africa enforces anti-disinformation measures relating to the COVID-19 Pandemic in the Government Gazette on March 18, 2020. Any persons who publishes "any statement through any medium, including social media with intention to deceive any other person about COVID-19; the infection status of any person; any measure taken by the Government to address COVID019" is committing an offence.

description: On 1 June 2020, the Department of Basic Education in the Republic of South Africa laid out a plan of phased reopening of schools. From 1 June 2020, Grade 7, 12 and School of Skills: Year 4 will reopen. Learners in ECD (Grade R or lower in a school); Grade 1,2,3,6,10 and 11; School of Skills: Years 2 and 3;Schools for Learners with Severe Intellectual Disabilities ("SID"): Grades R, 1, 2, 3 and 6; and Special Care Centres for Learners with Severe and Profound Intellectual Disabilities ( "LSPID "): Years 1 -3 will reopen on 6 July 2020. Grade 4,5, 8 and 9; School of Skills: Year 1; and Schools for Learners with Severe Intellectual Disabilities( "SID "): Grades 4 and 5 will reopen on 3 August 2020 .

institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions

description: On the 17 August 2020, The Republic of South Africa announced that  under Alert Level 2 from 18 August 2020 to 20 September 2020, a curfew will be enforced in which  "every person is confined to his or her place of residence from 22H00 until 04H00, except where a person is granted a permit to perform a services other than a services related activities listed under 'Specific economic exclusion' or to attend to a security or medical emergency".

Republic of South Africa prohibits Public Transport as of March 26 2020 at 23h59.

During the lockdown period all commuter transport service [...] is prohibited, except [...] for the purposes of rendering essencial services, obtaining essential goods, seeking medical attention, funeral services and to recieve [the] payment of grants: Provided that such vehicle carries no more than 50% of the licenced capacity and all directions in respect of hygenic conditions [...] are adhered to.

Republic of South Africa, policy effective from: March 26 2020 at 23h59 until April 16 2020 23h59.

SA is enforcing a 21-day mandatory quarantine for all South Africans, as well as any tourists and persons staying within the borders of the republic. "For the period of this Lockdown every person is confined to his or her place of residence (exceptions: for the purpose of performing an essencial service, obtaining an essential good or service, collecting a social grant, or seeking emergency, life-saving, or chronic medical attention)... and every gathering is prohibited (exception: funerals, max. 50 people in attendance)"
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
In the Republic of South Africa, under Alert Level 4, from May 1 to May 31, every person is confined to his/her place of residence, only able to leave to: 
A) Perform an essential service. 
B) Go to work, with an issued permit. 
C) Buy permitted goods.
D) Obtain services that are allowed to operate. 
E) Move children, as allowed. 
F) Walk, run or cycle in the permitted hours:  06H00 to 09H00.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The Republic of South Africa allows visits "to the extent and in the manner directed by the Cabinet member responsible" to: correctional centres, remand detention facilities, police holding cells, military detention facilities,  facilities controlled by the Department of Social Development, under Alert Level 4 from May 1 to May 31.

The Republic of South Africa allows visits "to the extent and in the manner directed by the Cabinet member responsible" to health establishment and facilities, with exception to when one is receiving treatment or medication in accordance with health protocols - under Alert Level 4, from May 1 to May 31.

The Republic of South Africa, under Alert Level 3 from June 1 to August 17, enforces that those abiding in the Republic are only permitted to leave his/her place of residence to: 
A) Perform any allowed service. 
B) Travel to and from work. 
C) Buy goods or obtain services.
D) Move children. 
E) Exercise between allowed hours. 
F) Attend a place of worship. 
G) Attend a school or learning insitution, when opened.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

The Republic of South Africa's President participates in the WHO's "launch  of a global collaboration to accelerate the development, production and equitable global access to new COVID-19 essential health technologies" on April 24 2020.

description: The Republic of South Africa announces the deployment of law enforcers made up of the South African Police Service (SAPS); the South African National Defence Force (SANDF), and metro police units […] to enforce the [lockdown] regulations" on March 23 2020.

The Republic of South Africa announces the deployment of "about 24 389 law enforcers made up of the South African Police Service (SAPS); the South African National Defence Force (SANDF), and metro police units [...] to enforce the [lockdown] regulations" on April 02 2020.

The Republic of South Africa announces the "Social Security Agency (SASSA) has also set aside over R400 million for social relief of distress through food parcels and vouchers to be rolled out on a larger scale" and "over 100,000 households across the country have been provided with food parcels, with further households being targeted through the Solidarity Fund and Department of Social Development’s Disaster Relief Fund" since the beginning of the lockdown on April 18 2020.

description: The Republic of South Africa announces that "Mining operations [as classified as an essencial service] must be conducted at a reduced capacity of not more than 50% during the period of lockdown, and thereafter at increasing capacity as determined by direction issued by the Cabinet member responsible for mineral resources and energy" on April 16 2020.

description: The Republic of South Africa announces measures to "ensure the continuous supply of energy and petroleum products to society as referred to in paragraph 6 of Part B of Annexure B- (a) collieries that supply Eskom must continue to operate at full capacity; and (b) refineries must operate at full capacity to avoid shortage of fuel, and such operations must include smelters, plants and furnaces" on April 16 2020.

description: The Republic of South Africa's President meets with "social partners represented in the National Economic Development and Labour Council (NEDLAC) to discuss deepening cooperation as part of the national effort to combat the coronavirus pandemic" on April 17 2020.

description: The Republic of South Africa's President announces further steps in the fight against COVID-19: "Firstly, an extraordinary health budget to respond to coronavirus, secondly, the relief of hunger and social distress, Thirdly, support for companies and workers, Fourthly, the phased re-opening of the economy." on April 21 2020.
